trans-unit.source: Deploy the StorSimple Manager service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy the StorSimple Manager service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to create and delete the StorSimple Manager service in the Management Portal, and describes how to manage the service registration key.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to create and delete the StorSimple Manager service in the Management Portal, and describes how to manage the service registration key.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service runs in Microsoft Azure and connects to multiple StorSimple devices.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service runs in Microsoft Azure and connects to multiple StorSimple devices.

trans-unit.source: After you create the service, you can use it to manage the devices from the Microsoft Azure Management Portal running in a browser.
trans-unit.target: After you create the service, you can use it to manage the devices from the Microsoft Azure Management Portal running in a browser.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to monitor all the devices that are connected to the StorSimple Manager service from a single, central location, thereby minimizing administrative burden.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to monitor all the devices that are connected to the StorSimple Manager service from a single, central location, thereby minimizing administrative burden.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager landing page lists all the StorSimple Manager services that you can use to manage your StorSimple storage devices.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager landing page lists all the StorSimple Manager services that you can use to manage your StorSimple storage devices.

trans-unit.source: For each StorSimple Manager service, the following information is presented on the StorSimple Manager page:
trans-unit.target: For each StorSimple Manager service, the following information is presented on the StorSimple Manager page:

trans-unit.source: Name – The name that was assigned to your StorSimple Manager service when it was created.
trans-unit.target: Name – The name that was assigned to your StorSimple Manager service when it was created.

trans-unit.source: The service name cannot be changed after the service is created.
trans-unit.target: The service name cannot be changed after the service is created.

trans-unit.source: Status – The status of the service, which can be Active, Creating, or Online.
trans-unit.target: Status – The status of the service, which can be Active, Creating, or Online.

trans-unit.source: Location – The geographical location in which the StorSimple device will be deployed.
trans-unit.target: Location – The geographical location in which the StorSimple device will be deployed.

trans-unit.source: Subscription – The billing subscription that is associated with your service.
trans-unit.target: Subscription – The billing subscription that is associated with your service.

trans-unit.source: The common tasks that can be performed through the StorSimple Manager page are:
trans-unit.target: The common tasks that can be performed through the StorSimple Manager page are:

trans-unit.source: Create a service
trans-unit.target: Create a service

trans-unit.source: Delete a service
trans-unit.target: Delete a service

trans-unit.source: Get the service registration key
trans-unit.target: Get the service registration key

trans-unit.source: Regenerate the service registration key
trans-unit.target: Regenerate the service registration key

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to perform each of these tasks.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to perform each of these tasks.

trans-unit.source: Use the Quick Create option to create a StorSimple Manager service if you want to deploy your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Use the Quick Create option to create a StorSimple Manager service if you want to deploy your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: To create a service, you need to have:
trans-unit.target: To create a service, you need to have:

trans-unit.source: A subscription with an Enterprise Agreement
trans-unit.target: A subscription with an Enterprise Agreement

trans-unit.source: An active Microsoft Azure storage account
trans-unit.target: An active Microsoft Azure storage account

trans-unit.source: The billing information that is used for access management
trans-unit.target: The billing information that is used for access management

trans-unit.source: You can also choose to generate a default storage account when you create the service.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose to generate a default storage account when you create the service.

trans-unit.source: A single service can manage multiple devices.
trans-unit.target: A single service can manage multiple devices.

trans-unit.source: However, a device cannot span multiple services.
trans-unit.target: However, a device cannot span multiple services.

trans-unit.source: A large enterprise can have multiple service instances to work with different subscriptions, organizations, or even deployment locations.
trans-unit.target: A large enterprise can have multiple service instances to work with different subscriptions, organizations, or even deployment locations.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to create a service.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create a service.

trans-unit.source: Before you delete a service, make sure that no connected devices are using it.
trans-unit.target: Before you delete a service, make sure that no connected devices are using it.

trans-unit.source: If the service is in use, deactivate the connected devices.
trans-unit.target: If the service is in use, deactivate the connected devices.

trans-unit.source: The deactivate operation will sever the connection between the device and the service, but preserve the device data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The deactivate operation will sever the connection between the device and the service, but preserve the device data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: After a service is deleted, the operation cannot be reversed.
trans-unit.target: After a service is deleted, the operation cannot be reversed.

trans-unit.source: Any device that was using the service will need to be factory reset before it can be used with another service.
trans-unit.target: Any device that was using the service will need to be factory reset before it can be used with another service.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the local data on the device, as well as the configuration, will be lost.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the local data on the device, as well as the configuration, will be lost.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to delete a service.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to delete a service.

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, select the service that you wish to delete.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, select the service that you wish to delete.

trans-unit.source: Click Delete at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Delete at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes in the confirmation notification.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes in the confirmation notification.

trans-unit.source: It may take a few minutes for the service to be deleted.
trans-unit.target: It may take a few minutes for the service to be deleted.

trans-unit.source: After you have successfully created a service, you will need to register your StorSimple device with the service.
trans-unit.target: After you have successfully created a service, you will need to register your StorSimple device with the service.

trans-unit.source: To register your first StorSimple device, you will need the service registration key.
trans-unit.target: To register your first StorSimple device, you will need the service registration key.

trans-unit.source: To register additional devices with an existing StorSimple service, you will need both the registration key and the service data encryption key (which is generated on the first device during registration).
trans-unit.target: To register additional devices with an existing StorSimple service, you will need both the registration key and the service data encryption key (which is generated on the first device during registration).

trans-unit.source: For more information about the service data encryption key, see <linkText>StorSimple security</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the service data encryption key, see <linkText>StorSimple security</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can get the registration key by accessing Registration Key on the Services page.
trans-unit.target: You can get the registration key by accessing Registration Key on the Services page.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to get the service registration key.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to get the service registration key.

trans-unit.source: Keep the service registration key in a safe location.
trans-unit.target: Keep the service registration key in a safe location.

trans-unit.source: You will need this key, as well as the service data encryption key, to register additional devices with this service.
trans-unit.target: You will need this key, as well as the service data encryption key, to register additional devices with this service.

trans-unit.source: After obtaining the service registration key, you will need to configure your device through the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple interface.
trans-unit.target: After obtaining the service registration key, you will need to configure your device through the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple interface.

trans-unit.source: For details on how to use this registration key, see <linkText>Step 3: Configure and register the device through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on how to use this registration key, see <linkText>Step 3: Configure and register the device through Windows PowerShell for StorSimple</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You will need to regenerate a service registration key if you are required to perform key rotation or if the list of service administrators has changed.
trans-unit.target: You will need to regenerate a service registration key if you are required to perform key rotation or if the list of service administrators has changed.

trans-unit.source: When you regenerate the key, the new key is used only for registering subsequent devices.
trans-unit.target: When you regenerate the key, the new key is used only for registering subsequent devices.

trans-unit.source: The devices that were already registered are unaffected by this process.
trans-unit.target: The devices that were already registered are unaffected by this process.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to regenerate a service registration key.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to regenerate a service registration key.

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click Registration Key.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click Registration Key.

trans-unit.source: In the Service Registration Key dialog box, click Regenerate.
trans-unit.target: In the Service Registration Key dialog box, click Regenerate.

trans-unit.source: You will see a confirmation message.
trans-unit.target: You will see a confirmation message.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to continue with the regeneration.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to continue with the regeneration.

trans-unit.source: A new service registration key will appear.
trans-unit.target: A new service registration key will appear.

trans-unit.source: Copy this key and save it for registering any new devices with this service.
trans-unit.target: Copy this key and save it for registering any new devices with this service.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to close this dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to close this dialog box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about the StorSimple deployment process</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about the StorSimple deployment process</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about managing your StorSimple storage account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about managing your StorSimple storage account</linkText><title></title>.
